## AlRouteAction interface

The action associated with a route. These are only the most common properties.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface AlRouteAction 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [callback](./common.alrouteaction.callback.md) | <code>{</code><br/><code>        (route: AlRoute, mouseEvent?: any): void;</code><br/><code>    }</code> | If the type of the action is 'callback', this is the anonymous function that will be executed. |
|  [location](./common.alrouteaction.location.md) | <code>string</code> | If the route action is 'link' (default), these properties indicate which application (location) and route (path) OR url (fully qualified) the link should point to. |
|  [path](./common.alrouteaction.path.md) | <code>string</code> |  |
|  [trigger](./common.alrouteaction.trigger.md) | <code>string</code> | If the type of the action is 'trigger', this is the name of the event to be triggered. |
|  [type](./common.alrouteaction.type.md) | <code>string</code> | What type of action does this route have? Valid types are 'link', 'trigger', and 'callback' |
|  [url](./common.alrouteaction.url.md) | <code>string</code> |  |
